eventName: So Long, Adele: Home Away From Home
storyInfo: Eyjafjalla is informed by Keller that an item has gone missing from the museum's collection, whereupon she realizes it's the Little Black Sheep up to no good. Fashion Street remains collectively opposed to being relocated, and after being thwarted at work again, Costa unexpectedly meets his childhood friend Keller at the museum.

attributes.content: I'm telling you, everything's weird about that Ann-Maier no-tail!
attributes.name: Archosauria A

attributes.content: She eats food and gets eggshell in her mouth, she takes her turn crossing a bridge and the rope somehow snaps, she builds a house and a waterfall floods it, she goes fishing and gets caught BY a big fin!
attributes.name: Archosauria A

attributes.content: Oh, I remember Inam said something about being, uh, what was it? Born under an unhunky star?
attributes.name: Archosauria B

attributes.content: Born under an unlucky star.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Don't forget to give Ann-Maier your thanks, you two. With the way you practically party on the job, who knows how long building these houses would've taken without her!
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: BOOMâ€”
*cough* *cough*, *cough* *cough*!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Wh-What's going on? How did the door explode?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: It's fine, I can fix it up ASAP... I was blow-drying the glue on the hinges, and I probably futzed the hairdryer, hahaha...
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Glue?
attributes.name: Archosauria A

attributes.content: That's my wine pot. My old nocih gave it to me.
attributes.name: Archosauria B

attributes.content: *ahem* You've moved everything over, right?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Everything's here now. We spent all morning shifting it! I'm gonna take myself a good long bath tonight.
attributes.name: Archosauria A

attributes.content: All morning? This is freight of some kind... coffee?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Yes, it's Siestan coffee. We've opened up a trade route with Siestan merchants, and these are the first goods they sent.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Let me take a look, I think I can see the instructions on these bags... 'Roast the flower seeds and coffee beans together'... Siestans adjust the bitterness of their coffee that way.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: My grandpa made coffee like that too, when I was young.
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: I believe he was a Siestan, Miss Ann-Maier?
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: Yeah... but we moved to Columbia so long ago. Once I finish work this month, I'll have enough saved to catch a ride back to Siesta!
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.content: Huh? I would've let Siesta's merchants take you back if I knew. They left just over an hour ago.
attributes.name: Inam

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Ann-Maier

attributes.text: Goal of observation: Obtain first-hand survey data for the eruption of Mount Unna, calculate numerical Originium particulate concentration gradient decrease in surrounding environment at time of eruption, establish a theoretical model

attributes.content: In an old notebook is sandwiched a photograph.
Three people lined up in mountaineering gear, three smiling faces reddened by the alpine wind.
Professor Keller was... there in the team lineup too.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: She was meant to be a member by all rights on that investigation.
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: But the day before they ascended, Keller suddenly left the team, and went back to William University.
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: She withdrew just like that? Was there some reason for it?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: It's a mystery, and the observation diaries don't make a single mention of it. All we know is right after that accident, Keller showed up at a meeting between William University and the Leithanian government.
attributes.name: Kahn

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly, were you there then...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: *sigh*... You still won't pay attention to me until I find what you're looking for...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: You know, Mr. Dolly, have you heard of volcano watchers? They're a kind of flower that changes color based on a volcano's activity. Is it the seeds of those flowers you're looking for?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Or... obsidian, maybe? With how they're buried in the soil, the black crystals look a lot like seeds too, don't they...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele mumbles to herself, garnering no response, and the tremendous volcanic rock specimen before her is as taciturn as ever.
Am I just overthinking this...?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Mr. Dolly, I'll only be able to find what you're looking for that quickly if you give me more of a hint...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele? Are you searching for something?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: ...No, Professor Keller.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Keller watches Adele close the notebook, and put it away in the storage box.
Adele hangs her head, picks up the other files around her, and buries her parents' notes beneath them.
Adele... if anything is gnawing at you, you can come straight to me.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Adele is silent for a spell.
Nothing I can think of, Professor Keller.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: I'm here to catch you up on some matters.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: According to data sent back from the forward sensor station, and analysis of the obsidian sample, we've concluded that Mount Siesta's eruption may well come a few days soon.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Readings from the mountain have always been unusual. Active energy from its internal Originium veins peaked two years prior in the summer, then rapidly fell after, before once more slowly rising.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: We don't have much time left to prepare; we'll need to act fast.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Oh! The volcano's erupting sooner? How lucky can we be?
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: (Whisper) Mr. Dolly! Please don't jump out of nowhere...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele, are you listening?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Yes! I'm listening!
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Adele, I know with the ample experience you already boast as a scholar, pre-observation prep work amounts to little more than busywork for you. But please maintain your focus, okay?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I'm sorry! Professor Keller...
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Mrohh... So your professor caught you playing hooky.
attributes.name: Dolly

attributes.content: Oh, yes, have you bumped into any peculiar tourists at the museum lately?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Did something happen?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: A whistling rock specimen in the hands-on area went missing.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: A whistling rock? One that sounded musical when blown through?
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: It looks like we'll want to report to city hall's people to increase security at the museum too.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I'll keep a look out myself.
attributes.name: Adele

attributes.content: Maybe it's something about the weatherâ€”there's been a lot of strange things happening lately, and authorities say cases of people losing their own possessions have been unusually high.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: I was listening to the news this morning, and someone apparently took out their grudge on the depot at the unfinished plate too. They made a complete mess of it over there.
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: Manager, we've run up the damaged goods. Nothing really unaccounted for, it's mainly notable damage to the outer box packaging. Aside from some foodstuffs, we haven't lost too much at all.
attributes.name: MountainDash Logistics Employee

attributes.content: Good, noted.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I'm sorry to have this sort of thing happen in Siesta; it was caused by the carelessness of our own work. I can only ask this won't impact your thoughts on collaborating with us...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Of course, if you do decide to suspend partnership, I'll report the full reality to Mayor Herman.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Though in that event, I imagine it'll be tough on him to lose a business partner, and tough on me to lose my job...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Assigning blame is secondary. I first need to ensure nothing like this will happen again.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: It looks like... people really aren't welcoming MountainDash's plans for the new plate.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: I'm glad that I can still be wholly face-to-face with you to coordinate business.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: ...Excuse me?
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Er, given that having the residents here accept redevelopment isn't meant to be part of your work at all.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: MountainDash Logistics's future collaborations with Siesta can't stand independent of their support. I don't want the people to deem the redevelopment a form of unilateral imposition.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: That you're concerned at all is really gratifying.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Things being what they are, I'd appreciate city hall keeping an eye on security work around the warehouse. Fingers crossed no accidents like this will be happening again.
attributes.name: Bison

attributes.content: Alright, I'll pass on your comments, and I'll make sure they lead to some action.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: For my job, my rent, and my worried fiancee's sakes, I thank you, Mr. Bison.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: If you have no other arrangements here, I'll be continuing my efforts to talk the commercial district into signing the relocation LOI.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Miss Swire, I'm deeply sorry I couldn't show you the proper hospitality when you paid a visit earlier.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: How has your impression of New Siesta been, over your tour these past few days?
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Very clean, very eye-candyâ€”but missing a little sense of amusement, possibly even stiff. To be honest, I more prefer how it used to be.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Very coincidentally, my daughter said much the same thing.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: But Siesta's been forced to leave its golden shoreline, which means it's only a matter of time before tourism fails as our economic backbone.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Oh, pity. I was quite fond of that 'Old Siesta Fashion Street' and all...
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You're very much confident about partnering with MountainDash Logistics, I take it?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I have just as much hope in the differing solution you provide, Miss Swire.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: On that note, your family's group maintains its clarion reputation. It wasâ€”a surprise, though, that their candidate for investment executive was you.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: I also just happened to learn that you've apparently registered a new business here in Siesta, operating in the construction, cultural and recreational fields...?
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: It appears your trust isn't quite in me, Mr. Mayor. You think I don't hold enough clout in the conglomerate yet?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Of course notâ€”the future is always in your hands as the young ones. Just, the dealings we had with the 'corporation' from Victoria happened to pop into my head. That was thirty-plus years ago by now.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: Freeing itself from the swollen ambitions of Victoria wasn't a casual affair for the Siesta of then. Anyone even remotely familiar with Siestan history would understand that.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And the sheer capacity you demonstrated in the dispute, Mayor Herman, still has politicians abuzz today.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: For my part, you don't need to be too anxiousâ€”I'm not here in any convoluted capacity. Besides, all I've brought are sincere partnership, and more business opportunities.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: You, Miss Swire, intend to contest MountainDash Logistics for rights to develop the newly constructed plate. I, of course, am willing to see friendly competition from both sides, and Siesta is always welcoming of partnerships in good faith.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: I very much look forward to the proposals you submit at bidding, and wish you pleasant journeys for the rest of your time in Siesta.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: After you're back in Lungmen, please, send your grandfather my regards.
attributes.name: Herman

attributes.content: I'm not signing this thing!
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: We've already moved once before, and you're still putting us through this rigmarole... And how do you expect us to make a living once you shut our place down, anyway...?
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: If the Mayor can't give us a clear explanation, we're not even thinking about relocating.
attributes.name: Restaurant Owner

attributes.content: Or are you going to force us?
attributes.name: Bar Owner

attributes.content: Costa, you wormed your way into city hall! Those bigwigs don't even live in the same universe as us, and now all you can do is jump when they say jump? You can't figure something out with us?
attributes.name: Bar Owner

attributes.content: Even if you're not here to take over your grandpa's coffee shop, we still need this street to make a living.
attributes.name: Bar Owner

attributes.content: *sigh*... We've been wracking our brains looking for a way to spark business here again... Help us think of something, okay?
attributes.name: Bar Owner

attributes.content: Ooh, if it isn't Mr. City Hall himself? Here to kick us off our street again? Forget the moment you wore that fancy uniform just where you came from?
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I'm ashamed for your grandfather.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: I hate my job...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Excuse me, is my ice cream ready?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Coming right up!
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Sorry for the wait. Here, your quadruple-scoop.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: By the way, that man who got his head chewed offâ€”who's he?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Never mind him. Just an ill omen trying to tear our homes down.
attributes.name: Elderly Shopkeeper

attributes.content: Got what I asked for?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Did anyone notice you coming here?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Officer, I'm sorry to report, Lut and Liv saw me!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: *ahem*... Alright, is that out of our systems? You can hand me the stuff now.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Did you get down with insiders like this as a cop too? It's kind of cool!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: This bag has general info on every shop in the commercial district. How many live at each, roughly how their business is doing, the personalities of the owners you asked about, I've noted you down a little of all that.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: In this bag is a series of MountainDash's recent maneuvers. Something about some kind of purchase of Siestan specialties, and they say they're selling them off to Victoria and Columbia. In pretty decent quantities, too.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Well, good going! How did you even get your hands on these MountainDash files?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Totally simple. Just had to apply to be a freight trucker with them.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Well, signs say that Bison kid's trying to buy out the people's will this way... Yes, that does seem his style.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Suppose he manages to build a new distribution center here. Would the populace here want to switch jobs?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Enis, gimme a curaÃ§ao!
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: ...You got it.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: What's got you moody? I can tell, actually. You're sick of it too, no? Hanging the sign back up again and allâ€”you guys doing a little protesting that way?
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: All this crap is a killer. The lovefowls next door were all over each other at first. Now they're arguing day by day about the rehousing...
attributes.name: Cold Drinks Shop Owner

attributes.content: Here's your drink, one curaÃ§ao!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: ...There's negative interest in moving on this street.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: For the most part, yeah... Moving means planning a whole new life from scratch. We only just moved aboard the nomadic city, even, and a lot of us are still getting used to it.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Even tourists are a rarity now, after all. Business is hard enough as is, and plenty ended up unemployed. Move again, and life gets even harder...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Enis shakes his head, and gives up on the subject.
Enis, if I wanted to run a place like yours, how much would upkeep be on average?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Per month, about... five hundred gold certificates, just under that?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Hm? That little?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: I can buy a lot of stuff second-hand elsewhere, or just make it myself. Plus with how we usually conserve on utility bills, it adds up to a lot less than you think.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Sometimes it really makes me wonder... Have rich people like you just gone your whole lives without much worry?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Does a person just need enough money, and everything in life shakes out how they want?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: ...Money's a hassle-killer, but not an issue-solver.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: *sigh*. If we have to move, if there's no other choice, then what are you thinking? Once you get contracted for this plate, what are you going to build here?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: I'd rather ask you first. If a rebuild is guaranteed, then what would you want this high street to become?
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Strictly in fantasy terms?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Mm-hm.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: ...A giant waterpark.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: We'd build the land's biggest waterpark, second to none. Maybe it might even draw in some tourists. That way, we wouldn't need to let this bar go either. Probably.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: And plus, my little brother and sister have been hounding us forever about going to a waterpark.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Ooh, good idea.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Is that all it takes...?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: You make me feel like you're not even here to compete for real, versus the MountainDash boy...
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Hmph. Plenty who've vied with me thought the same thing.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: They all rolled over and lost.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Pfft. That's some kind of power.
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Enis! Help me paint the shop sign here. The trade fair's right around the corner, and we need our storefront looking the best it can.
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Coming!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Y'know, we still have paint left over from last time, and I bought a couple string lights for cheap a few days ago. Want me to go put those up in a bit?
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Sure, and if there's any paint left after that, give the tables and chairs and picture frames a new coat too. Lut and Liv were saying they learned how to draw from someone, right? Can you tag them in too?
attributes.name: Harley

attributes.content: Sure, will do now!
attributes.name: Enis

attributes.content: Hey, Enis!
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Paint the sign in orange. I have eyes you can trustâ€”this'll draw in more customers than before, guaranteed.
attributes.name: Swire

attributes.content: Costa forgets how he even got here.
At some point since moving to New Siesta, this atypically architected building cropped up on his route home from work. Buried somewhere in him is the impression he'd handled its paperwork.
The Volcano Museum? Why would people go to all the effort to put a museum for this on this luxurious plate? What's to study about volcanoes?
Stop it!
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Nuh-uh! I wanna see the big rock! I wanna see the lava!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: *sigh* Why you're desperate to see this stuff is a total mystery.
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Volcanoes are really cool!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: Hrmph! Cool...
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: A phrase floats to Costa's mind. 'You can see such beautiful things from the tops of volcanoes,' he vaguely remembers someone telling him.
Can you name all these volcanoes? I can!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: Why would I ever need to know...?
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Okay, I'll tell you! This one is Mount Tambora, this one is Mount Katla, this one is Mount Merapi, this one is Mount Ya... Yaaaa...
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: 'Yasur'.
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Wah! You were behind me and you just came up and said a thing and you scared me!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: Ah, sorry for that...
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: (How did I know that? I don't remember anymore.)
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Humph! I knew Mount Yasur, I knew that! It's the prettiest volcano on the land, and on top of it you can see flowing lava everywhere, and they're like gentle little streams...
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: I got that all from a book! I remember it really really well!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: But I can't find any signs that explain stuff here... I need to show you how I got everything right!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: You did, you're right! Are we done? There's not even a placard in sight here, we're goingâ€”
attributes.name: Tourist

attributes.content: Apologies for inconveniencing you on your trip. This exhibition area isn't fully arranged yet, but explanatory texts will soon be laid out on theseâ€”
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: No, Mr. Volcano Man, I'm not done yet, you gotta keep listening!
attributes.name: Child Tourist

attributes.content: Costa is tugged by the hem of his jacket. Somewhat helplessly stopped in place, he tries to explain that he really needs to go.
He turns his head, and reflected in the glass display shelves, he sees an unexpected face.
You...?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: Costa...?
attributes.name: Keller

attributes.content: You're... you're back?
attributes.name: Costa

attributes.content: And I ain't gonna be just a face in the crowd! â™ª
You're gonna hear my voice when I shout it out lou-oud! It's my life! â™ª
Ah, my bad, I didn't realize there were customers in.
That's weird, though. How come someone's sitting in a cafe reading quietly while the Obsidian Festival's on? You mind if I practice guitar here?
*sigh* No, Grandpa'll rag on me for bothering customers again. Maybe I'll just bide my time so I get a new guitar sooner.
What's that you're reading? A book about volcanoes... This is pretty cool. Can you lend me it?
Will you be here again, tomorrow?
